alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monmouth and central Middlesex Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Brunswick, or near New Brunswick, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerset, Edison, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Matawan, Jamesburg, Brownville, North Brunswick Township, Morganville, Woodbridge, South River, Highland Park, Metuchen, Spotswood, Keyport and Milltown. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 12. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 2. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 117 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
